content.Article: October 31, 2023 The U.S. Strategy and National Action Plan on Women, Peace, and Security (WPS) released today calls for a deliberate focus on the protection of women and girls during conflict. The approach could have a bearing on how the United States engages in the current Israel-Hamas conflict. The strategy and action plan, updating the 2019 version, also addresses the impact of climate change, technology-facilitated gender-based violence, and the increased participation of women throughout the U.S. national security enterprise. RAND experts view these as critical issues, in light of current national security challenges.
